publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1409# Dr Elaine Murray: Congratulations to Food Train, Dumfries and Galloway - Queen's Award for Voluntary Service 2004-That the Parliament congratulates the Food Train, Dumfries and Galloway, on being one of the 110 organisations in the United Kingdom to be awarded the Queen's Award for Voluntary Service on 1 June 2004; notes the expansion of its operations delivering groceries to elderly and disabled people throughout Dumfries and Galloway over the last year and the training and experience being offered to its increasing numbers of volunteers; further congratulates the Food Train on the introduction of its services in Dalkeith, Midlothian, and looks forward to similar services being established throughout Scotland.

S2M-1409# Dr Elaine Murray: Congratulations to Food Train, Dumfries and Galloway - Queen's Award for Voluntary Service 2004-That the Parliament congratulates the Food Train, Dumfries and Galloway, on being one of the 110 organisations in the United Kingdom to be awarded the Queen's Award for Voluntary Service on 1 June 2004; notes the expansion of its operations delivering groceries to elderly and disabled people throughout Dumfries and Galloway over the last year and the training and experience being offered to its increasing numbers of volunteers; further congratulates the Food Train on the introduction of its services in Dalkeith, Midlothian, and looks forward to similar services being established throughout Scotland. Supported by: Christine Grahame*

S2M-1409# Congratulations to Food Train, Dumfries and Galloway - Queen's Award for Voluntary Service 2004 (lodged on 3 June 2004) Margaret Jamieson*, Helen Eadie*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Robin Harper*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Christine May*, Mark Ballard*, Frances Curran*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*

S2M-1409# Congratulations to Food Train, Dumfries and Galloway - Queen's Award for Voluntary Service 2004 (lodged on 3 June 2004) Chris Ballance*, Mr David Davidson*, Karen Gillon*, Scott Barrie*, Tommy Sheridan*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-1409# Congratulations to Food Train, Dumfries and Galloway - Queen's Award for Voluntary Service 2004 (lodged on 3 June 2004) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Trish Godman*
S2M-1409# Congratulations to Food Train, Dumfries and Galloway - Queen's Award for Voluntary Service 2004 (lodged on 3 June 2004) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S2M-1409# Congratulations to Food Train, Dumfries and Galloway - Queen's Award for Voluntary Service 2004 (lodged on 3 June 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
